1.1—Vision
To be the promoter and provider of quality Local Government services and networks in Kiribati and the Pacific.
1.2—Mission
The Kiribati Local Government Association is a forum of local government, an important player and equal partner in development, that focuses on the capacity building of its members for the delivery of quality services to their local communities through effective advocacy, lobbying, partnerships and negotiations with all its partners and stakeholders.

1.3—Objectives
The main objectives of the Association are:

1.3.1 To provide a forum where members can cooperate, discuss and seek solutions to issues, challenges and common interest; (Strategy 1)

1.3.2 To advocate and lobby, on behalf of the members, with central government and other stakeholders; (Strategy 2)

1.3.3 To become a bureau of information and source of advice on information and visibility for Local Councils; (Strategy 3)

1.3.4 To improve and support the Councils’ performance through capacity building programmes; (Strategy 4)

1.3.5 To assist Local Councils to be financially sustainable, especially in securing adequate revenue to meet their responsibilities; (Strategy 4)

1.3.6 To engage in business ventures to support its own and members delivery of services; (Strategy 5)

1.3.7 To ensure that the Association is financially and structurally sustainable with continuing support by its members, the central government and partners. (Strategy 5)
